page.title: 05Ecology around Langho (2)
page.content: Rabbits and hedgehogs are common and we see many starlings , robins , blackbirds , magpies and tits fly near houses . Coots have been seen on Dean Clough , sometimes owls are heard , lapwing and curlew occur on moorland . White and tortoiseshell butterflies fly in summer , ladybirds and aphids very common , of spiders , Salticus in summer , Araneus in Autumn . These bald statements do no justice to the vairety of life here . In clear weather the view from the hills above York includes the Fylde coast , Blackpool tower , Longridge, Waddington Fells , Fountains Fell and Pen-y-Ghent, Eastward Pendle dominates S.E. Hameldon and the Colne valley . In the foreground lies the Ribble Valley , green and fertile .
